name: Male literacy rate (Houston (1982))
description: Percentage of male witnesses who sign court depositions, for the North. Years given correspond to the decade, i.e. 1640 estimate covers the period 1640-1649. Original Table 1 (pg 204) gives percentage who are illiterate. To arrive at current estimates: % who are literate = 100 - (% who are illiterate)
datasetName: Literacy in England, by sex - Schofield (1973), Houston (1982), Cressy (1980)

source.name: R.A Houston (1982)
source.dataPublishedBy: Houston, R.A., 1982. The Development of Literacy: Northern England, 1640â€“1750. The Economic History Review, 35(2), pp.199-216.
source.dataPublisherSource: Northern Circuit Assizes Deponents, source of data: P.R.O. ASSI45
source.additionalInfo: See Table 1 (pg 204) for original figures. Table 1 provides the percentage who are illiterate. To arrive at current estimates: % who are literate = 100 - (% who are illiterate)
